list_definition.definition: a person or thing that sweeps

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: May I borrow your carpet sweeper?

list_ex_of_english: In some places it is most unpleasant to walk in the mornings until the road sweepers have cleared the roads and pavements.
They can tow traditional inshore sweepers which break down from the source of activity.
I served on a local authority that had the idea of getting rid of the old road sweepers with their brushes.
If my understanding is right, armed trawlers are frequently used as mine sweepers.
With regard to transport, road sweepers earn more than bus drivers.
The 350 people in the factory were firemen, doorkeepers, sweepers, packers and drivers.
After that we are lucky if we get only four carpet sweepers, and still luckier if they take only half an hour each.
Why, for example, are non-electrical carpet sweepers sensitive, but electric carpet sweepers, presumably, are not?
